intro: Apinagia divertens, commonly known as the bent-stalked apinagia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its unique, often curved stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in the summer months. Apinagia divertens is of interest to botanists due to its distinctive morphology and ecological adaptations.
